intro: Ormenis scariosa, commonly known as the scarious ormenis, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ormenis scariosa is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and is sometimes used in herbal medicine.
